Bundle.title: Grab and Go
Bundle.description: You can snatch up an item to use as a weapon in the blink of an eye.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything, base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: As a free action, you can pick up an unattended item as part of a movement. Picking up the item does not provoke an attack of opportunity. If you have Throw Anything, you can pick up a number of closely gathered items that could be held in one hand (such as dishes from a stack of plates) equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum 1). You must have a hand free to use this feat.

Bundle.title: Grabbing Drag
Bundle.description: You can move easily with a grappled enemy in tow.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Grabbing Style, Improved Grapple; base attack bonus +8, brawler level 4th, or monk level 4th.

Benefit.p: When you are using Grabbing Style, if you use the move grapple action, you can move both yourself and a single target that you're grappling your full speed instead of half your speed. After you have done so, you can use a move action to move yourself and the target of your grapple half your speed without needing to attempt an additional combat maneuver check. You cannot use this feat if you are grappling two targets.

Bundle.title: Grabbing Master
Bundle.description: You can grapple two foes as easily as one.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Grabbing Drag, Grabbing Style, Improved Grapple; base attack bonus +12, brawler level 8th, or monk level 8th.

Benefit.p: When you are grabbing two opponents while using Grabbing Style, you can use your grapple to move or damage one or both opponents you are grappling, instead of just one.

Bundle.title: Grabbing Style
Bundle.description: You are adept at the one-handed grab.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Grapple; base attack bonus +6, brawler's flurry class feature, or flurry of blows class feature.

Benefit.p: When you use this style, you do not take a -4 penalty on combat maneuver checks to grapple a foe with only one hand. Additionally, you do not lose your Dexterity bonus to AC while pinning an opponent.

Normal.p: Without two hands free, you take a -4 penalty on the combat maneuver roll to grapple a foe. While pinning a foe, you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC.

Bundle.title: Graceful Steal
Bundle.description: You can steal with surprising subtlety.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 13, Agile Maneuvers, Improved Steal, Sleight of Hand 3 ranks.

Benefit.p: When attempting Sleight of Hand checks to lift or palm objects, you can use your Combat Maneuver Bonus for a steal combat maneuver in place of your Sleight of Hand modifier, though if you do so, you must use your Dexterity modifier and not your Strength modifier. You can steal items with the steal combat maneuver even if they are hidden in a bag or pack (provided you can reach the item within), but the opponent gains at least a +5 bonus to its CMD (as for a fastened object) in this case.

Bundle.title: Grasping Strike
Bundle.description: The surrounding foliage lurches forth at your enemies in concert with your strikes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Nature Magic or the ability to cast druid or ranger spells; Vital Strike, Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks.

Benefit.p: When you use Vital Strike (or Improved Vital Strike or Greater Vital Strike), you cause the foliage in the area to reach out and entangle your foe (as the condition) if it fails a Reflex save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wisdom modifier). The effect lasts for 1 minute or until the enemy breaks free with a successful Strength check or an Escape Artist check (DC = the effect's saving throw DC), whichever comes first.

You can use this benefit a number of times per day equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). You can choose to use this ability as a free action after you hit the enemy with the attack. This is a supernatural ability.

Bundle.title: Grasping Tail
Bundle.description: Your tail becomes more useful.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Tiefling.

Benefit.p: You can use your tail to grab stowed items. While you cannot wield weapons with your tail, you can use it to retrieve small, stowed objects carried on your person as a swift action.

Special.p: If you have the prehensile tail racial trait, you can use your tail to grab unattended items within 5 feet as a swift action as well as to grab stowed objects carried on your person; you can hold such objects with your tail, though you cannot manipulate them with your tail (other than to put them in your hand).

Bundle.title: Great Cleave
Bundle.description: You can strike many adjacent foes with a single blow.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +4.

Benefit.p: As a standard action, you can make a single attack at your full base attack bonus against a foe within reach. If you hit, you deal damage normally and can make an additional attack (using your full base attack bonus) against a foe that is adjacent to the previous foe and also within reach. If you hit, you can continue to make attacks against foes adjacent to the previous foe, so long as they are within your reach. You cannot attack an individual foe more than once during this attack action. When you use this feat, you take a -2 penalty to your Armor Class until your next turn.
Editor's Note
Can I use Cleave or Great Cleave to cleave to or from an image created by a mirror image spell?

No. If your initial attack hit the caster, you can't cleave to an image as if it were an actual creature. If your initial attack hit an image, you failed to hit your intended target (the caster), and therefore can't cleave. As you can't specifically target an image (because you can't tell the images from the actual caster), you likewise can't aim for an image and try to cleave to another image.
[Source]
Can I take a 5-foot step in the middle of my attempt to use the Cleave feat, to bring another foe within reach?

No. Cleave is a special action and the conditions for that action are checked at the moment you begin your action. At that moment, all of the available targets are checked to make sure they adjacent to each other and within reach. You cannot take a 5-foot step in the middle of the action and check conditions again. If you do not have two targets within reach, adjacent to each other at the start of the attack, you could not even attempt to make an attack using Cleave.
[Source]

Bundle.title: Great Fortitude
Bundle.description: You are resistant to poisons, diseases, and other maladies.

Benefit.p: You get a +2 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.

Bundle.title: Great Hatred
Bundle.Prerequisites: Gnome, hatred racial trait.

Benefit.p: You gain an additional +1 bonus on melee and thrown weapon attacks against targets of your hatred racial trait.

Bundle.title: Great Rend
Bundle.description: You use your teeth and claws to rip your foes to shreds.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Bite attack, rend, troll.

Benefit.p: If you are able to use your rend ability on the same turn that you also succeed at a bite attack, your rend deals an amount of additional damage equal to half your Strength modifier.

Bundle.title: Greater Balor Whip
Bundle.description: You can pull in foes with your whip and then attack them with your sword.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Balor Whip, Improved Balor Whip, Weapon Focus (whip), Whip Mastery, base attack bonus +16.

Benefit.p: When you use Improved Balor Whip to make a single attack at your highest attack bonus, your critical threat range increases to 19-20 and you gain a +4 bonus on critical confirmation rolls if you threaten a critical hit with that attack.

Bundle.title: Greater Beast Hunter
Bundle.description: You are an apex hunter.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Beast Hunter; Improved Beast Hunter; base attack bonus +6; Knowledge (nature) or Survival 6 ranks.

Benefit.p: If you are surprised by an animal native to the terrain you have chosen for Beast Hunter, you can act normally in the surprise round, though you are still considered flat-footed until it is your turn to act. You also gain a +4 bonus to confirm critical threats against animals native to the terrain you have chosen.

Special.p: If you have selected Beast Hunter multiple times, you gain the benefits of this feat for all of the terrains you have chosen for those feats.

Bundle.title: Greater Blighted Critical
Bundle.description: Your critical hit from a spell or spell-like ability afflicts the target with a major spellblight.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Blighted Critical, caster level 12th.

Benefit.p: Whenever you confirm a critical hit with a touch spell, ranged touch spell, or spell-like ability against an opponent, the victim gains a random major spellblight.

Special.p: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.

Bundle.title: Greater Blind-Fight
Bundle.description: Your enemies cannot hide from you.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Perception 15 ranks, Improved Blind-Fight.

Benefit.p: Your melee attacks ignore the miss chance for less than total concealment, and you treat opponents with total concealment as if they had normal concealment (20% miss chance instead of 50%). You may still reroll a miss chance percentile roll as normal.

If you successfully pinpoint an invisible or hidden attacker, that attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you with ranged attacks, regardless of the range. That is, you don't lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible.

Special.p: The Greater Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a blink spell.

Bundle.title: Greater Bull Rush
Bundle.description: Your bull rush attacks throw enemies off balance.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Bull Rush. Whenever you bull rush an opponent, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).

Normal.p: Creatures moved by bull rush do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Bundle.title: Greater Called Shot
Bundle.description: You can make multiple called shots where others could land but one.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Called Shot, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: Whenever you make an attack, you can choose to replace that attack with a called shot. You can make multiple called shots in a single round. Each additional called shot after the first made in the same round takes a -5 penalty. In addition, a called shot that deals half the creature's hit points of damage (minimum 40) is a debilitating blow.

Normal.p: You can make only one called shot in a round as a full-round action. A called shot that deals 50 points of damage is a debilitating blow.

Bundle.title: Greater Dirty Trick
Bundle.description: When you pull a dirty trick, your foe is truly hindered.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Dirty Trick, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to attempt a dirty trick. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Dirty Trick. Whenever you successfully perform a dirty trick, the penalty lasts for 1d4 rounds, plus 1 round for every 5 by which your attack exceeds the target's CMD. In addition, removing the condition requires the target to spend a standard action.

Normal.p: The condition imposed by a dirty trick lasts for 1 round plus 1 round for every 5 by which your attack exceeds the target's CMD. Removing the condition requires the target to spend a move action.

Bundle.title: Greater Disarm
Bundle.description: You can knock weapons far from an enemy's grasp.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on combat maneuver checks made to disarm a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Disarm. Whenever you successfully disarm an opponent, the weapon lands 15 feet away from its previous wielder, in a random direction.

Normal.p: Disarmed weapons and gear land at the feet of the disarmed creature.

Bundle.title: Greater Drag
Bundle.description: Foes that you drag are thrown out of balance.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Improved Drag, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to drag a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Drag. Whenever you drag a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).

Normal.p: Creatures moved by drag do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Bundle.title: Greater Feint
Bundle.description: You are skilled at making foes overreact to your attacks.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Combat Expertise, Improved Feint, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

Benefit.p: Whenever you use feint to cause an opponent to lose his Dexterity bonus, he loses that bonus until the beginning of your next turn, in addition to losing his Dexterity bonus against your next attack.

Normal.p: A creature you feint loses its Dexterity bonus against your next attack.

Bundle.title: Greater Grapple
Bundle.description: Maintaining a grapple is second nature to you.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +6, Dex 13.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Grapple. Once you have grappled a creature, maintaining the grapple is a move action. This feat allows you to make two grapple checks each round (to move, harm, or pin your opponent), but you are not required to make two checks. You only need to succeed at one of these checks to maintain the grapple.

Normal.p: Maintaining a grapple is a standard action.

Bundle.title: Greater Hunter's Bond
Bundle.description: Your allies can target additional foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Hunter's Bond, hunter's bond (hunting companions) class feature, ranger level 12th.

Benefit.p: When you activate hunter's bond, you can select a number of targets equal to your Wisdom modifier as long as they all count as your favored enemy.

Normal.p: You select one target against which your allies receive your favored enemy bonus.

Bundle.title: Greater Mesmerizing Feint
Bundle.description: You can feint against nearly any creature.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Mesmerizing Feint, Bluff 10 ranks, hypnotic stare class feature, psychic inception bold stare.

Benefit.p: You can feint against mindless creatures at a –4 penalty. Such a creature must be a subject of your hypnotic stare, and the creature has a 50% chance of ignoring the effects of your feint.

Normal.p: Feinting against a creature that is mindless is impossible.

Bundle.title: Greater Overrun
Bundle.description: Enemies must dive to avoid your dangerous move.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Overrun, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrun a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Overrun. Whenever you overrun opponents, they provoke attacks of opportunity if they are knocked prone by your overrun.

Normal.p: Creatures knocked prone by your overrun do not provoke an attack of opportunity.

Bundle.title: Greater Penetrating Strike
Bundle.description: Your attacks penetrate the defenses of most foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Penetrating Strike, Weapon Focus, 16th-level fighter.

Benefit.p: Your attacks made with weapons selected with Weapon Focus ignore up to 10 points of damage reduction. This amount is reduced to 5 points for damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/—).

Bundle.title: Greater Rending Fury
Bundle.description: When your claws latch on to an opponent, the effect is bloody and horrific.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Rending Fury, Rending Fury, base attack bonus +12, rend special attack.

Benefit.p: Whenever you rend an opponent, you deal 1d6 bleed damage to that opponent. This is an addition to the effects of the rend.

Bundle.title: Greater Reposition
Bundle.description: When you reposition foes, they are left vulnerable to the attacks of your allies.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Reposition, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to reposition a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Reposition. Whenever you reposition a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).

Normal.p: Creatures moved by reposition do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Bundle.title: Greater Serpent Lash
Bundle.description: Your ability to disarm and pull foes off balance with your whip is impressive.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Serpent Lash, base attack bonus +4

Benefit.p: When you make a successful disarm or trip maneuver using the Serpent Lash feat, you can make your additional disarm or trip attempt against any target within your whip's reach. With a reposition maneuver, you can move the target creature to any point within your whip's reach.

Bundle.title: Greater Shield Focus
Bundle.description: You are skilled at deflecting blows with your shield.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Shield Focus, Shield Proficiency, base attack bonus +1, 8th-level fighter.

Benefit.p: Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Shield Focus.

Bundle.title: Greater Shield Specialization
Bundle.description: Your masterful shieldwork provides even greater protection to your vital areas.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Proficiency with selected shield, Greater Shield Focus, Shield Focus, Shield Specialization with selected shield, fighter level 12th.

Benefit.p: Choose one type of shield (buckler, light, heavy, or tower shield) for which you possess the Shield Specialization feat. With the selected shield, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against critical hit confirmation rolls (this bonus stacks with that from Shield Specialization). In addition, once per day you may negate a critical hit, and damage is instead rolled normally.

Special.p: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of shield.

Bundle.title: Greater Snap Shot
Bundle.description: You can prey on any gap in your foe's guard with impunity, and with even greater range.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 17, Improved Snap Shot, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, base attack bonus +12.

Benefit.p: Whenever you make an attack of opportunity using a ranged weapon and hit, you gain a +2 bonus on the damage roll and a +2 bonus on rolls to confirm a critical hit with that attack. These bonuses increase to +4 when you have base attack bonus +16, and to +6 when you have base attack bonus +20.

Bundle.title: Greater Spring Attack
Bundle.description: You are a scything wind cutting through the battlefield as you topple your foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 17, Acrobatic Steps, Dodge, Improved Spring Attack, Mobility, Nimble Moves, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +16.

Benefit.p: When you use Spring Attack, you can select three targets to attack during your movement instead of one. The second attack made this way is made at your full base attack bonus - 5, and the third attack made this way is made at your full base attack bonus - 10. All restrictions of Spring Attack apply to each target, and your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from any of your targets. You can't target the same creature more than once.

Special.p: A monk of at least 18th level can select this feat as a monk bonus feat, but only if he has Improved Spring attack and Spring Attack.

Bundle.title: Greater Steal
Bundle.description: You have a knack for snatching items from your opponents in combat.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Steal, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to steal an item from a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Steal. If you successfully steal an item from a foe during combat, it does not notice the theft until after combat is over or if it attempts to use the missing item.

Normal.p: Creatures automatically notice items taken from them through the steal combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Greater Subjective Slam
Bundle.description: Your gravitational impact is meteoric, and your ability to use the act of falling devastating.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Con 15; Wis 15; Subjective Mobility; Subjective Slam; base attack bonus +8 or monk level 7th.

Benefit.p: When using Subjective Slam, you take only a –1 penalty on the combat maneuver check for every 100 feet of falling speed, and the maximum damage for such a slam increases to 12d6.

Bundle.title: Greater Sunder
Bundle.description: Your devastating strikes cleave through weapons and armor and into their wielders, damaging both item and wielder alike in a single terrific strike.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Sunder, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Sunder. Whenever you sunder to destroy a weapon, shield, or suit of armor, any excess damage is applied to the item's wielder. No damage is transferred if you decide to leave the item with 1 hit point.

Bundle.title: Greater Trip
Bundle.description: You can make free attacks on foes that you knock down.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Trip. Whenever you successfully trip an opponent, that opponent provokes attacks of opportunity.

Normal.p: Creatures do not provoke attacks of opportunity from being tripped.
FAQ

The Greater Trip feat allows you to take an attack of opportunity against a foe that you trip. The Vicious Stomp feat allows you to take an attack of opportunity against a foe that falls prone adjacent to you. If you have both these feats and trip a foe, do you get to make two attacks of opportunity (assuming that you can)?

Yes, the two triggering acts are similar here but they are different. One occurs when you trip a foe. The other occurs when a foe falls prone. It requires a large number of feats to accomplish, but you can really pile on the attacks with this combination.

Bundle.title: Greater Two-Weapon Fighting
Bundle.description: You are incredibly skilled at fighting with two weapons at the same time.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 19, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.

Benefit.p: You get a third attack with your off-hand weapon, albeit at a -10 penalty.

Bundle.title: Greater Vital Strike
Bundle.description: You can make a single attack that deals incredible damage.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Vital Strike, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +16.

Benefit.p: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon's damage dice for the attack four times and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a critical hit, but are added to the total.

Bundle.title: Greater Weapon Focus
Bundle.description: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected Weapon Focus. You are a master at your chosen weapon.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, base attack bonus +1, 8th-level fighter.

Benefit.p: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including those from Weapon Focus.

Special.p: You can gain Greater Weapon Focus multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

Bundle.title: Greater Weapon Specialization
Bundle.description: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you possess the Weapon Specialization feat. Your attacks with the chosen weapon are more devastating than normal.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Proficiency with selected weapon, Greater Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Specialization with selected weapon, 12th-level fighter.

Benefit.p: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus to damage stacks with other damage roll bonuses, including any you gain from Weapon Specialization.

Special.p: You can gain Greater Weapon Specialization multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

Bundle.title: Greater Weapon of the Chosen
Bundle.description: Your deity guides your hand when you fight with her favored weapon.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Weapon of the Chosen, Weapon Focus with deity's favored weapon, Weapon of the Chosen, worship and receive spells from a deity.

Benefit.p: When you use your deity's favored weapon to attempt a single attack with the attack action, you roll two dice for your attack roll and take the higher result. You do not need to use your Weapon of the Chosen feat to gain this feat's benefit. As usual, the reroll does not apply to any confirmation rolls.

Bundle.title: Greater Whip Mastery
Bundle.description: You can use a whip to make combat maneuvers with ease.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Whip Mastery, Weapon Focus (whip), Whip Mastery, base attack bonus +8.

Benefit.p: You are so quick with your whip that you never drop it due to a failed disarm or trip combat maneuver attempt. Further, you gain the ability to grapple using your whip. To do so, use the normal grapple rules with the following changes.
Attack: You cannot use your whip to attack while you are using it to grapple an opponent.
Damage: When dealing damage to your grappled opponent, you deal your whip's weapon damage rather than your unarmed strike damage.
Free Hands: You take no penalty on your combat maneuver check for having fewer than two hands free when you use your whip to grapple.

Reach: Rather than pulling your grappled opponent adjacent to you when you successfully grapple and when you move the grapple, you must keep him within your whip's reach minus his own reach to maintain the grapple. If the difference in reach is less than 0, such as is the case for a Medium whip wielder and a Gargantuan creature, you cannot grapple that opponent with your whip. If you have to pull a creature adjacent to you to grapple it with your whip, you still provoke an attack of opportunity from that opponent unless you have the Improved Grapple feat.

Tie Up: While adjacent to your opponent, you can attempt to use your whip to tie him up. If you do so to an opponent you have grappled rather than pinned, you take only a -5 penalty on the combat maneuver check rather than the normal -10.

Bundle.title: Greater Wilding Strike
Bundle.description: You reach the pinnacle of your wilding strike abilities.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 18, Improved Unarmed Strike, Improved Wilding Strike, Wilding, Wilding Strike, base attack bonus +16.

Benefit.p: The damage die of your unarmed strikes increases to 1d10 (or 1d8 if you are Small). This does not stack with any other effects that increase the damage die of your unarmed strikes, including levels in classes such as monk. Increases to your actual size category (such as enlarge person) still increase your damage die as normal.

Bundle.title: Ground-Grabber
Bundle.description: When pressed by big opponents, you hunker down to more easily keep your feet.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Con 13.

Benefit.p: You gain a +2 competence bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense against awesome blow, bull rush, drag, reposition, or trip combat maneuvers from opponents larger than you.

Bundle.title: Grow Plant Creature
Bundle.description: Through careful study and communion with nature, you have learned how to cultivate and raise plant creatures.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Train Plants, Handle Animal 5 ranks, Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks.

Benefit.p: You can grow plants and perform rituals to invest them with animating spirits, becoming assassin vines, treants, or viper vines. Each plant creature has a list of additional prerequisites, costs, and skill checks required to grow them (see Growing Plant Creatures below). At the GM's discretion, characters with this feat may grow other plant creatures as well.

The process of growing a plant companion is very similar to the process of growing a leshy. The creator begins by growing an array of especially verdant plants, and then performs rituals to have a spirit of nature inhabit it. Typically, the creator is a powerful druid, but anyone capable of making the required Knowledge checks and casting the required spells may attempt the process.Cultivated minions closely resemble more familiar plant creatures— and share the same stat blocks—but are approximated copies woven from horticulture and magic.An 'assassin vine' cultivated by a druid using the Grow Plant Creature feat isn't a true assassin vine, and the seeds it produces would sprout into mundane ivy, grape vines, or similar vines originally used to construct it. At the GM's discretion, this may allow druids to grow plant minions with special abilities, such as a peach treant who produces fruit or a viper vine woven from stinging nettles whose touch causes burning welts. Such adjustments should always increase the cost to create a plant creature, and should adjust their challenge rating if they greatly expand the minion's combat abilities or utility.Growing a plant creature takes 2 weeks per Hit Die, during which the creator must fertilize, water, and protect the growth. During this period, the creator must use certain rare nutrients and fertilizer to prime the transformation from a normal plant into a plant creature—the cost of these components varies according to the type, but is never less than 1,000 gp per Hit Die.The cultivator must succeed at a Knowledge (nature) check at this time in order to properly form the plant body—the exact check as well as the required DC varies according to the creature. If the check fails, the plant withers and dies and the cultivator must begin anew.If the skill check is successful, the cultivator must then perform a 24-hour awakening ritual. During this ritual, the cultivator must cast the spells detailed in each individual creature's entry. At the awakening ritual's climax, there is a flat 50% chance that the attempt to create the creature succeeds—if this final check fails, no appropriate spirit is close enough to answer the call. The plant body becomes dormant, and remains so for 3 months. After this time, another awakening ritual can be performed (requiring another 1,000 gp of materials); this new ritual also has a flat 50% chance of success. At the GM's discretion, the awakening ritual's chance for success might increase to 75% or even 100% in natural and unspoiled environments appropriate to the individual creature. Discovering such a rare and magical site should be the focus of its own adventure. If the awakening ritual is successful, the creature awakens fully formed. A freshly created plant creature is under no particular compulsion to obey its creator, but most regard their makers as friends and allies.Plant creatures are particularly adept at growing other plant creatures of the same type. Sentient creatures of the plant type gain a +5 racial bonus on their Knowledge (nature) checks to cultivate other plant creatures, halve the time required to grow the creature, and reduce the materials cost by 25%. A plant creature improves the success chance of any awakening ritual it personally performs by 5% per Hit Die it possesses.At the GM's discretion, it may be possible to create plant creatures with more Hit Dice than normal. Each additional Hit Die adds 2,250 gp to the cost of creating it (and thus 4,500 gp to the overall price), increases the DC of the Knowledge check by 2, and requires an additional 2 weeks of growth.

Bundle.title: Gruesome Slaughter
Bundle.description: You can inspire extreme revulsion when you slaughter your enemies.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Intimidating Prowess, Killing Flourish, Intimidate 11 ranks, slayer level 11th.

Benefit.p: Creatures you demoralize by using the Killing Flourish feat must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your character level + the higher of your Strength or Dexterity modifier) or become sickened for 1 minute.

Bundle.title: Guided Star Combat
Bundle.description: The grace of the associated deity guides your starknife to its target and back to your hand.

Bundles.Bundle:
Note This is associated with a specific deity. Starry Grace, worshiper of the associated deity.
You can empower a starknife with magical power once per day per character level as a swift action.
Until the end of your turn, add your Wisdom modifier to your damage rolls with the starknife in addition to any other modifiers you normally add. If you throw the starknife during that time, it returns to you at the beginning of your next turn (as per the returning weapon special ability).

Bundle.title: Halfling Slinger
Bundle.description: You have honed your racial talent for slingcraft.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Halfling.

Benefit.p: You gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls made using a sling.

Bundle.title: Hamatula Grasp
Bundle.description: You deal terrible damage to impaled foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Hamatula Strike, Improved Grapple, Strength 13, Base Attack Bonus +9.

Benefit.p: When attacking an impaled opponent (see Hamatula Strike) with the weapon that impales them, you only suffer a -2 penalty to your grapple check. If the check succeeds, you deal an extra 1d6 damage.

Bundle.title: Hamatula Strike
Bundle.description: You can catch your opponents on your weapon and hold them in place.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Grapple, Strength 13, Base Attack Bonus +7.

Benefit.p: Whenever you damage an opponent with a piercing weapon, you can immediately make a grapple check; success means the opponent is impaled on your weapon and you both gain the grappled condition. While the opponent is impaled, as an attack action you may make a grapple check on your turn at a -4 penalty to damage the opponent with your weapon, even if your weapon cannot normally be used in a grapple.

Normal.p: You can only attack with an unarmed strike, natural weapon, or light weapon against opponents you are grappling.

Bundle.title: Hamatulatsu
Bundle.description: You have mastered a deadly fighting form inspired by the hideous attacks of the barbed devil.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Unarmed Strike, Weapon Focus (unarmed strike).

Benefit.p: Your unarmed attacks can deal either bludgeoning or piercing damage. You decide which type of damage you deal whenever you attack a foe, but you may only choose one type at a time. If you critically hit a foe with your unarmed strike while doing piercing damage, the additional pain caused by the strike causes the foe to become sickened for 1 round (or staggered for 1 round if the target is already sickened). Multiple critical hits in a round against a single foe do not increase the duration of the sickened or staggered condition.

Special.p: Hamatulatsu may be selected as a substitute bonus feat at 6th level by a monk even if the monk does not otherwise meet the prerequisites. This fighting style is normally only taught to women of a specific fighting school.
Combat Trick
Note If using the optional Stamina Pool rules, the following trick may be used with this feat.
Combat Trick: By spending 5 stamina points, you can treat a hit with an unarmed strike as a critical hit for the purpose of determining the benefits that you gain from Hamatulatsu.

Bundle.title: Hammer Throw
Bundle.description: You can throw a hammer with such force that it knocks your foes over.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Trip, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +1, dwarf.

Benefit.p: As a standard action, you can make a single ranged attack with a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage against a creature no more than one size category larger than you that is within the weapon's first range increment.

If you hit and damage the target, you can immediately attempt to perform a trip combat maneuver against that target. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity, and if your combat maneuver check fails by 10 or more, you do not fall prone.

Bundle.title: Hammer the Gap
Bundle.description: You repeatedly strike the same location, causing increasing amounts of damage.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: When you take a full-attack action, each consecutive hit against the same opponent deals extra damage equal to the number of previous consecutive hits you have made against that opponent this turn. This damage is multiplied on a critical hit.

Bundle.title: Haunted Gnome
Bundle.description: You use your gnome magic to take on an eerie illusory appearance.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Cha 13, gnome magic racial trait, Knowledge (arcana) 1 rank.

Benefit.p: You add haunted fey aspect to your list of gnome magic spell-like abilities, and you can use this spell-like ability twice per day.

Bundle.title: Haunted Gnome Assault
Bundle.description: Discharging your disturbing glamer as you strike a telling blow, you haunt a foe with lingering fear.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Cha 13, gnome magic racial trait, Haunted Gnome, Knowledge (arcana) 3 ranks.

Benefit.p: You gain one use of your gnome magic that is independent of your gnome magic spell-like abilities. When you wish to cast a gnome magic spell-like ability for which you have no daily uses remaining, you can expend this independent use to do so.

Further, while you are under the effect of haunted fey aspect, you can discharge that spell as a free action after you hit an opponent with a charge attack or score a critical hit against an opponent. If you do, that opponent becomes shaken for 1 round.

Bundle.title: Haunted Gnome Shroud
Bundle.description: Your disturbing glamer expands to make your exact location hard to pinpoint.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Cha 13, gnome magic racial trait, Haunted Gnome, Haunted Gnome Assault, Knowledge (arcana) 6 ranks.

Benefit.p: You gain another independent use of your gnome magic like that which Haunted Gnome Assault grants. Further, while you are under the effect of haunted fey aspect, you also have concealment (20% miss chance) against an opponent until that opponent deals you damage.

Bundle.title: Hefty Brute
Bundle.description: You might be a different subspecies or simply a well-fed and well-grown beast, but either way you're built on a more massive scale than the rest of your kind.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Animal companion or familiar.

Benefit.p: You treat your size as one category larger for the purposes of calculating CMB, CMD, carrying capacity, and any size-based special attacks you use or that are used against you (such as grab, swallow whole, and trample).

Bundle.title: Heighten Spell
Bundle.description: You can cast spells as if they were a higher level.

Benefit.p: A heightened spell has a higher spell level than normal (up to a maximum of 9th level). Unlike other metamagic feats, Heighten Spell actually increases the effective level of the spell that it modifies. All effects dependent on spell level (such as saving throw DCs and ability to penetrate a lesser globe of invulnerability) are calculated according to the heightened level.
Level Increase: The heightened spell is as difficult to prepare and cast as a spell of its effective level.

Bundle.title: Hellcat Pounce
Bundle.description: You attack unsuspecting foes twice.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Hellcat Stealth, Skill Focus (Stealth), sneak attack +2d6.

Benefit.p: Whenever you attack and damage an opponent in the surprise round, you may immediately make a second attack against the same opponent using the same attack bonus. The target is not considered flat-footed against this second attack.

Special.p: This ability only functions when carrying a light load or less.

Bundle.title: Hemorrhaging Venom
Bundle.description: Your venom destroys blood vessels and melts bone.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Spit Venom, Virulent Venom, base attack bonus +7, nagaji.

Benefit.p: Your ability to spit poison granted by the Spit Venom feat deals 2d6 points of bleed damage on a failed saving throw in addition to all other effects. The bleeding can be stopped as normal with a successful DC 15 Heal check or the application of any effect that heals hit point damage. In addition, you gain one additional use per day of the ability to spit poison granted by the Spit Venom feat.

Bundle.title: Hero's Display
Bundle.description: With a dramatic flourish you display your weapons to the crowd. Onlookers are elated, and your enemies are demoralized.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dazzling Display, Weapon Focus, and proficiency with the selected weapon.

Benefit.p: When you spend a swift action to make a performance combat check, you present the weapon in which you have Weapon Focus in a triumphant display. You gain a +2 bonus on the performance combat check and make an Intimidate check to demoralize all foes within 30 feet who can see your display.

Bundle.title: Heroic Interposition
Bundle.description: You arrive just when you are most needed to vanquish evil.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 13, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Mobility, worshiper of an empyreal lord.

Benefit.p: Once per day, you can move up to your speed as an immediate action, but you must end this movement adjacent to an opponent who is about to make an attack against an ally. As long as you are visible to the opponent you moved next to, that opponent takes a -2 penalty on the attack roll to which you moved in response.
Combat Trick
Note If using the optional Stamina Pool rules, the following trick may be used with this feat.
Combat Trick: By spending 4 stamina points, you can use this feat an additional time per day.

Bundle.title: Heroic Leader
Bundle.description: Whether part of a partnership or an army, you stand head and shoulders above your companions.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Cha 13; any combat feat; ability to gain an animal companion, cohort, eidolon, familiar, or mount.

Benefit.p: Your animal companion, cohort, eidolon, familiar, or mount doesn't count as threatening your opponent for the purposes of feats that require you to be the only character threatening a target. Allies with Hit Dice equal to or less than 1/2 your own Hit Dice don't count as threatening opponents for the purposes of such feats.

Bundle.title: Hex Strike
Bundle.Prerequisites: Hex class feature, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Benefit.p: When you gain this feat, choose one hex that you can use to affect no more than one opponent. If you make a successful unarmed strike against an opponent, in addition to dealing your unarmed strike damage, you can use a swift action to deliver the effects of the chosen hex to that opponent. Doing so does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Special.p: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you take it, you apply it to a different qualifying hex.

Bundle.title: Hold the Blade
Bundle.description: You can take your opponent's weapon after being stabbed in the back.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Disarm, base attack bonus +10.

Benefit.p: Whenever an enemy deals damage to you with a melee weapon as part of a flanking attack or sneak attack, you can make a combat maneuver check to disarm against that opponent as an immediate action. You must have at least one hand free when you use this feat. When you use this feat, you take a -4 penalty to your AC until your next turn. You can only use this feat once per round.

Bundle.title: Hook Fighter
Bundle.description: In your deft hands, a climbing tool becomes a deadly weapon.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: You treat a grappling hook as a one-handed weapon that deals piercing damage equal to a heavy pick of its size and that has the disarm and trip special weapon features. You do not incur penalties as you would for using a grappling hook as an improvised weapon. If you are proficient with whips and your grappling hook has at least 10 feet of rope or chain attached to it, you can treat it as a two-handed melee weapon with 15-foot reach, though you can use it against foes anywhere within your reach (including adjacent foes), though you don't threaten any squares with it.

Changing between using a grappling hook as a normal weapon and a reach weapon is a move action. When performing a reposition maneuver with a grappling hook, you can only move the target toward you from its original position.

Bundle.title: Horn Rider
Bundle.description: You can defend yourself using the horn or tusk of a creature you're lashed to.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: You gain a +1 shield bonus to AC when lashed into a horn harness.

Special.p: A creature with this feat can take the Mounted Archery feat without possessing 1 rank in the Ride skill or the Mounted Combat feat.

Bundle.title: Horn Rider's Charge
Bundle.description: When the animal you're lashed to charges, you use its momentum in your own attack.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Horn Rider, base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: Whenever you're lashed into a horn harness and you ready an action to make a melee attack against the target of a charge made by the creature you're lashed to, you gain the attack bonus for charging and your attack deals double damage (or triple damage with a lance). This benefit does not stack with the benefit of Spirited Charge.

Bundle.title: Horn of the Criosphinx
Bundle.description: Hammer-masters developed a fighting style based on certain attributes of sphinxes, focusing particularly on how these creatures can stand steadfast even in the face of imminent onslaught or make their own deadly assaults at a moment's notice. You end your charge in a devastating two-handed attack.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Base attack bonus +6 or monk level 6th.

Benefit.p: Whenever you make a successful charge attack while wielding a two-handed weapon in both hands, add two times your Strength bonus to the damage roll.

Normal.p: A character wielding a two-handed weapon adds 1-1/2 times her Strength bonus to damage rolls.

Special.p: A monk can use this feat as long as he is wielding a two-handed weapon or both his hands are empty.
Note: A monk can take any of these feats as bonus feats at the indicated levels. To benefit from the feats, monks must have both hands free and capable of delivering an unarmed strike.

Bundle.title: Horrific Gorging
Bundle.description: In the space of a few horrific seconds, you can chew up and gulp down an entire humanoid body.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Bite attack, Large or larger, swallow whole universal monster ability.

Benefit.p: As a full-round action, you can completely consume a dead, unconscious, paralyzed, or otherwise helpless humanoid creature that you could normally swallow with your swallow whole ability. When you do, you deal bite damage as a critical hit and swallow the humanoid as your swallow whole special ability.

Allies of the swallowed creature within 30 feet that can see you indulge in this horrific feast must succeed at a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your Hit Dice + your Charisma modifier) to avoid being shaken for 1d4 rounds. This part of the ability is a mind-affecting fear effect.

Bundle.title: Horse Master
Bundle.Prerequisites: Expert trainer class feature, Ride 6 ranks.

Benefit.p: Use your character level to determine your effective druid level for determining the powers and abilities of your mount.

Normal.p: You use your cavalier level to determine your effective druid level for determining the powers and abilities of your mount.

Bundle.title: Human Spirit
Bundle.description: Your blood burns with the passion and unyielding quest for self-improvement displayed so prominently by your human relatives.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Half-elf.

Benefit.p: You receive 1 bonus skill rank. Whenever you gain another Hit Die, you gain an additional skill rank. You cannot gain more than four skill ranks in this way.

Special.p: You can only take this feat at 1st level. If you take this feat, you cannot take the Elven Spirit feat.

Bundle.title: Huntmaster
Bundle.description: You are an expert trainer of horses, hounds, falcons, or hunting cats.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Handle Animal 1 rank; either the animal companion, divine bond (mount), or mount class feature; human.

Benefit.p: If you have the animal companion class feature, pick one of the following types of animal companions that this feat affects: bird, dog, small cat, or horse. If you have the divine bond (mount) or mount class feature, this feat always affects horses. You gain a +2 bonus on Handle Animal and Knowledge (nature) checks with creatures of that type of animal. Furthermore, you are treated as one level higher when determining the abilities of your animal companion or mount, as long as it is of the chosen type.

Bundle.title: Hurricane Punch
Bundle.description: Your fast strikes hit with the force of a hurricane, pushing your foes away.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Improved Bull Rush, Improved Unarmed Strike, Power Attack.

Benefit.p: When you hit the same creature with unarmed strikes at least twice in the same round, you can attempt a bull rush combat maneuver against that creature as a swift action. You can also move with the target even if you have no movement remaining, but the distance you move can't exceed half your speed.

Bundle.title: Hurtful
Bundle.description: You know how to add injury to insult.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack.

Benefit.p: When you successfully demoralize an opponent within your melee reach with an Intimidate check, you can make a single melee attack against that creature as a swift action. If your attack fails to damage the target, its shaken condition from being demoralized immediately ends.

Bundle.title: Iconoclast
Bundle.description: You know how to turn a deity's holy symbol into a weapon against her followers.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Divine Defiance, Improved Sunder, Power Attack, Intimidate 3 ranks

Benefit.p: When you succeed at a sunder combat maneuver against a holy or unholy symbol, you can attempt an Intimidate check to demoralize as a free action. This demoralization affects all followers of the deity or philosophy whose symbol you sundered who saw you sunder it and are within 30 feet. If you destroyed the symbol, you gain a +5 bonus on your Intimidate check. You can use this feat when sundering any physical holy symbol - it doesn't have to be the hand-held variety commonly used by clerics and other divine spellcasters.

Bundle.title: Illusion Mastery
Bundle.description: You can weave figments with illusion magic items.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Use Magic Device 2 ranks, base Fortitude save bonus +4.

Benefit.p: You can cause an item that has an illusion spell of 1st level or higher in its construction requirements to cast minor image.
You can use this feat once per day, plus an additional time per day at base Fortitude save bonus +6, +8, +10, and +12.

Bundle.title: Illusive Gnome Bewilderment
Bundle.description: You can use your gnome weapons in unusual ways.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Gnome Weapon Focus, Illusive Gnome Style, Illusive Gnome Surprise, Improved Feint, gnome magic and weapon familiarity racial traits.

Benefit.p: While using Illusive Gnome Style, when you successfully use Bluff to feint against an opponent, you can pick one special weapon feature from among those listed by Illusive Gnome Surprise and deny the opponent its Dexterity modifier to AC, as normal for feinting; alternatively, you can pick two special weapon features instead of one.

Bundle.title: Illusive Gnome Style
Bundle.description: The chaotic, somewhat random design of your racial weapons makes it easy to combine them with illusions.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Gnome Weapon Focus, Improved Feint, base attack bonus +1, gnome magic and weapon familiarity racial traits.

Benefit.p: While feinting with a melee weapon that has 'gnome' in its name, you can sacrifice a spell slot, a spell of the illusion school, or a spell from the gnome magic racial trait to gain a bonus on the skill check attempted to feint. This bonus is equal to 1 + the level of the spell sacrificed. If you sacrifice a 0-level spell, you cannot cast or sacrifice that spell again for 24 hours.

Bundle.title: Illusive Gnome Surprise
Bundle.description: You can use gnome weapons in unusual ways.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Gnome Weapon Focus, Illusive Gnome Style, Improved Feint.

Benefit.p: While using Illusive Gnome Style, you gain a +2 bonus on combat maneuver checks to perform dirty tricks and on Bluff checks to feint. In addition, when you successfully use Bluff to feint against a foe, instead of denying that foe its Dexterity bonus to AC, you can treat one 'gnome' weapon that you are wielding as if it had one of the following weapon special features: blocking, brace, disarm, distracting, performance, sunder, or trip. This benefit applies only against that foe and lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1).

Bundle.title: Impact Critical Shot
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 13, Point-Blank Shot, base attack bonus +9.

Benefit.p: Whenever you score a critical hit with a ranged attack, in addition to the normal damage your attack deals, if your confirmation roll exceeds your opponent's CMD, you can push your opponent back as if from the bull rush combat maneuver or knock that target prone as if from a trip combat maneuver. If you choose to bull rush, you cannot move with the target. Your maneuver does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

Normal.p: You must perform a bull rush combat maneuver to bull rush an opponent, and you must perform a trip combat maneuver to trip an opponent.

Bundle.title: Impaling Critical
Bundle.description: Your critical hits can skewer your foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Critical Focus, Weapon Specialization with selected piercing melee weapon, base attack bonus +11.

Benefit.p: Whenever you score a critical hit with the selected piercing melee weapon, you can impale your opponent on your weapon. While your opponent is impaled in this way, each time he starts his turn, you deal damage equal to your weapon's damage dice plus the extra damage dice from your weapon's properties. As an immediate action, you can pull your weapon out of your opponent. If your opponent is ever outside your reach, you must spend a free action to let go of your weapon or pull it out of him. Your opponent can also spend a move action to pull your weapon out. When the weapon comes out, your opponent takes damage as if starting his turn impaled. While you impale your opponent with your weapon, you cannot use it to attack, and you must hold on to it.

Bundle.title: Implacable
Bundle.description: You aren't easily fazed, especially when you've been drinking.

Benefit.p: You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against pain effects. When you are drunk or soused, you gain DR 5/piercing or slashing.

Bundle.title: Improved Armor Focus
Bundle.description: Your mastery makes the most of your armor.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Armor Focus, base attack bonus +6, proficiency with selected armor.

Benefit.p: The armor check penalty of the selected armor decreases by 1 (to a minimum of 0). You also use your character level in place of your base attack bonus for the purpose of armor mastery feat prerequisites.

Special.p: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of armor.

Bundle.title: Improved Awesome Blow
Bundle.description: You are skilled at sending your opponents flying.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13; Awesome Blow or awesome blow class feature; Power Attack

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on checks to perform an awesome blow combat maneuver. You also gain a +2 bonus to your combat maneuver defense whenever an opponent tries to perform an awesome blow combat maneuver against you. Whenever you successfully perform an awesome blow combat maneuver, your opponent's movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all your allies (but not you).

Normal.p: Creatures moved by awesome blow do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Bundle.title: Improved Balor Whip
Bundle.description: You can pull in foes with your whip and attack them with your sword.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Balor Whip, Weapon Focus (whip), Whip Mastery, base attack bonus +12.

Benefit.p: When you succeed at a drag attempt with your whip against a non-adjacent target and the target ends the drag adjacent to you, as a free action you can make a single attack against the target at your highest attack bonus using the melee weapon held in your other hand. You gain an additional +2 bonus on drag combat maneuver checks when using a whip to drag, but this bonus does not stack with the bonus from Greater Drag.

Bundle.title: Improved Beast Hunter
Bundle.description: You are well trained in stalking and hunting the animals of the wild.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Beast Hunter; base attack bonus +3; Knowledge (nature) or Survival 3 ranks.

Benefit.p: When fighting animals that are at least one size category larger than you and that are native to the terrain you have chosen with Beast Hunter, you gain a +4 bonus on combat maneuver checks and a +4 to your CMD against such animals' attempts to use combat maneuvers against you. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus on Reflex saves against attacks by the animal that allow a Reflex save (such as attempting to avoid a trample attack).

Special.p: If you have selected Beast Hunter multiple times, you gain this benefit for all of the terrains you have chosen for those feats.

Bundle.title: Improved Blind-Fight
Bundle.description: Your keen senses guide your hand against hidden foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Perception 10 ranks, Blind-Fight.

Benefit.p: Your melee attacks ignore the miss chance for less than total concealment. You may still reroll your miss chance percentile roll for total concealment. If you successfully pinpoint an invisible or hidden attacker within 30 feet, that attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you with ranged attacks. That is, you don't lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible.

Special.p: The Improved Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a blink spell.

Bundle.title: Improved Bravery
Bundle.description: Your bravery protects you from more than just fear.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Cha 13, bravery class feature.

Benefit.p: Add your bravery bonus against all mind-affecting effects instead of just against fear.

Bundle.title: Improved Bull Rush
Bundle.description: You are skilled at pushing your foes around.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to bull rush you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Called Shot
Bundle.description: You are skilled at landing blows right where you want to.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: You receive a +2 bonus on attack rolls when making a called shot. When taking a full-round or standard action that gives you multiple attacks, you can replace a single attack with a called shot. You may only attempt one called shot per round.

Normal.p: You can make one called shot per round as a full-round action.

Bundle.title: Improved Channel Force
Bundle.description: You move your enemies within a beam of righteous energy.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Channel Force, Aasimar, channel energy 4d6.

Benefit.p: When using Channel Force, you can affect all creatures in a 60-foot line or a 30-foot cone-shaped burst. You must choose to either push or pull all creatures within the affected area that fail their saves.

Bundle.title: Improved Charging Hurler
Bundle.description: Every muscle in your body adds its force to your thrown weapons.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Charging Hurler, Point-Blank Shot.

Benefit.p: When you use Charging Hurler, your target can be at any range up to your weapon's maximum range. If your target is within 30 feet, you gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls.

Normal.p: Using Charging Hurler requires you to end your movement within 30 feet of your opponent.

Bundle.title: Improved Cleaving Finish
Bundle.description: You can cut down many opponents in a single strike.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Cleave, Cleaving Finish, Great Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: You can use Cleaving Finish any number of times per round.

Bundle.title: Improved Critical
Bundle.description: Attacks made with your chosen weapon are quite deadly.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Proficient with weapon, base attack bonus +8.

Benefit.p: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.

Special.p: You can gain Improved Critical multiple times. The effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
This effect doesn't stack with any other effect that expands the threat range of a weapon.

Bundle.title: Improved Dark Sight
Bundle.description: With further modification, your eyes see clearly in not only normal darkness, but in magical darkness as well.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dark Sight, Gloom Sight, fetchling

Benefit.p: You gain the see in darkness ability and lose the light sensitivity weakness, but gain the light blindness weakness.

Bundle.title: Improved Devastating Strike
Bundle.Prerequisites: Devastating Strike, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +13.

Benefit.p: Whenever you use Vital Strike, Improved Vital Strike, or Greater Vital Strike, you gain a bonus on attack rolls to confirm a critical hit equal to the bonus on damage rolls you gain from Devastating Strike.

Bundle.title: Improved Dirty Trick
Bundle.description: You are skilled at pulling dirty tricks on your foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a dirty trick combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to attempt a dirty trick. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries a dirty trick on you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a dirty trick combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Disarm
Bundle.description: You are skilled at knocking weapons from a foe's grasp.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a disarm combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to disarm a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to disarm you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a disarm combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Drag
Bundle.description: You are skilled at dragging foes around the battlefield.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a drag combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to drag a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to drag you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a drag combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Drow Nobility
Bundle.Prerequisites: Cha 13, Drow Nobility, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow.

Benefit.p: You may use your dancing lights, faerie fire, feather fall, and levitate spell-like abilities twice per day. Your darkness spell-like ability instead becomes deeper darkness, which you may use twice per day.

Bundle.title: Improved Feint
Bundle.description: You are skilled at fooling your opponents in combat.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: You can make a Bluff check to feint in combat as a move action.

Normal.p: Feinting in combat is a standard action.

Bundle.title: Improved Feinting Flurry
Bundle.description: Your first melee attack throws your opponent completely off guard.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 17, flurry of blows class feature, Combat Expertise, Feinting Flurry, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: While using Feinting Flurry, if you successfully feint, your opponent is denied its Dexterity bonus to AC until the end of your turn.

Normal.p: A successful feint causes your opponent to be denied its Dexterity bonus to AC against your next attack.

Bundle.title: Improved Fury of the Tainted
Bundle.description: Your hatred for goodness is rivaled only by your ability to repel it.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Cha 13, Fury of the Tainted, base attack bonus +8, rage class feature, tiefling.

Benefit.p: While raging, you gain spell resistance equal to 10 + your class level against spells with the [good] descriptor.

Bundle.title: Improved Grapple
Bundle.description: You are skilled at grappling opponents.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 13, Improved Unarmed Strike.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to grapple you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Hammer Throw
Bundle.description: Your ability to knock down your foes with ranged attacks is impressive.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Hammer Throw, Improved Trip, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +6, dwarf.

Benefit.p: You can use the Hammer Throw feat against targets at any range and of any size.

Bundle.title: Improved Hunter's Bond
Bundle.description: You deepen your connection to your allies, granting them higher bonuses.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Hunter's bond (hunting companions) class feature, ranger level 9th.

Benefit.p: When you activate hunter's bond, you can grant your allies your full favored enemy bonus against a single target.

Normal.p: Your allies receive half your favored enemy bonus against a single target.

Bundle.title: Improved Impaling Critical
Bundle.Prerequisites: Impaling Critical, Critical Focus, Weapon Specialization with selected piercing melee weapon, base attack bonus +13.

Benefit.p: While you are using Impaling Critical to impale an opponent, and you are still holding onto that weapon, that opponent must succeed at a grapple combat maneuver check against you to pull your weapon out. If you have let go of your weapon, the impaled opponent must spend a standard action to remove the weapon. Until the opponent pulls the weapon out, his speed in all modes is halved and his maneuverability, if any, is reduced by one step. When the weapon comes out, instead of dealing the damage normal for Impaling Critical, you can deal bleed damage equal to your weapon's damage dice result once per round at the start of that opponent's turn.

Bundle.title: Improved Improvisation
Bundle.description: You are masterful in your improvisation.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Fast Learner, Improvisation, human.

Benefit.p: Your nonproficiency penalty with weapons, armor, and shields is halved. In addition, the bonus on all skill checks for skills you have no ranks in increases to +4 instead of +2.

Bundle.title: Improved Initiative
Bundle.description: Your quick reflexes allow you to react rapidly to danger.

Benefit.p: You get a +4 bonus on initiative checks.

Bundle.title: Improved Intercept Blow
Bundle.description: The animal's intervention completely protects its master from harm.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Intercept Blow, base attack bonus +6, animal companion.

Benefit.p: When the animal companion uses Intercept Blow to intercept an opponent's melee attack and succeeds, it can take all the damage from the intercepted attack, in which case its master takes no damage from the intercepted attack and doesn't suffer effects that trigger on a hit.

Bundle.title: Improved Iron Will
Bundle.description: Your clarity of thought allows you to resist mental attacks.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Iron Will.

Benefit.p: Once per day, you may reroll a Will save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.

Bundle.title: Improved Ki Throw
Bundle.description: Your enemies are living weapons in your hands.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Improved Bull Rush, Ki Throw.

Benefit.p: When using the Ki Throw feat, you may throw your target into any square you threaten that is occupied by another creature. Make a bull rush combat maneuver check with a -4 penalty against the secondary target. If this check succeeds, the thrown creature lands prone in the secondary target's square, while the secondary target is pushed back and knocked prone in an adjacent square. If the check fails, the thrown creature lands prone in the nearest square you threaten adjacent to the secondary target.
If you throw a Large or larger creature into an area containing multiple secondary targets, you take an additional penalty of -4 on your combat maneuver check for each target after the first.

Special.p: A monk may take this as a bonus feat at 14th level.

Bundle.title: Improved Lightning Reflexes
Bundle.description: You have a knack for avoiding danger all around you.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Lightning Reflexes.

Benefit.p: Once per day, you may reroll a Reflex save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.

Bundle.title: Improved Overrun
Bundle.description: You are skilled at running down your foes.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing an overrun combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrun a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to overrun you. Targets of your overrun attempt may not chose to avoid you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing an overrun combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Parry
Bundle.description: A flick of the wrist binds your opponent's weapon.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: When you successfully parry a foe's melee attack (with a dueling parry or the parry class feature), your next melee attack against the target does not allow the enemy to apply its Dexterity bonus to AC (if any). This attack must be made before the end of your next turn.

Bundle.title: Improved Position of Strength
Bundle.description: You are particularly skilled in pressing your advantage when negotiating with noncombatants.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Position of Strength; Two-Weapon Fighting or Multiattack; Intimidate 5 ranks.

Benefit.p: As long as you are wielding one or more weapons with which you are proficient, you gain the bonus on Intimidate checks from Position of Strength against creatures that are armed with fewer weapons than you are wielding.

Bundle.title: Improved Precise Shot
Bundle.description: Your ranged attacks ignore anything but total concealment and cover.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 19, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +11.

Benefit.p: Your ranged attacks ignore the AC bonus granted to targets by anything less than total cover, and the miss chance granted to targets by anything less than total concealment. Total cover and total concealment provide their normal benefits against your ranged attacks.

Normal.p: See the normal rules on the effects of cover and concealment in Combat.

Bundle.title: Improved Punishing Step
Bundle.description: You know how to take advantage of a devastating charge.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 13, Dodge, Punishing Step, base attack bonus +8.

Benefit.p: Your bonus to AC from the Dodge feat increases to +2 against charge attacks. When a creature charges you and misses with its attack, it loses its Dexterity bonus to AC against the next melee attack you make against it before the end of your next turn. If a creature misses with multiple attacks (such as when using the pounce ability), you can make one such attack against the creature's flat-footed AC before the end of your next turn for each of that creature's attacks that missed you.

Bundle.title: Improved Rending Fury
Bundle.Prerequisites: Rending Fury, base attack bonus +9, rend special attack.

Benefit.p: Whenever you successfully rend an opponent, you deal an extra 1d6 damage. This damage is not multiplied on a critical hit.

Bundle.title: Improved Reposition
Bundle.description: You have learned how to force your enemies to move around the battlefield.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a reposition combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to reposition a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to reposition you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a reposition combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Second Chance
Bundle.description: You can turn a missed strike into a second chance without sacrificing later attacks.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Second Chance, base attack bonus +11.

Benefit.p: When you reroll a missed attack using the Second Chance feat, you can still make the rest of your attacks that turn, albeit at a -5 penalty to each attack.

Normal.p: When using the Second Chance feat, you must normally forgo the rest of your attacks that turn.

Bundle.title: Improved Shield Bash
Bundle.description: You can protect yourself with your shield, even if you use it to attack.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Shield Proficiency

Benefit.p: When you perform a shield bash, you may still apply the shield's shield bonus to your AC.

Normal.p: Without this feat, a character that performs a shield bash loses the shield's shield bonus to AC until his next turn (see Equipment).

Bundle.title: Improved Shield Focus
Bundle.description: Your mastery makes the most of your shield.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Shield Focus, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: You reduce the armor check penalty of any shield you are using by 1. You also use your character level in place of your base attack bonus for the purpose of shield mastery feat prerequisites.

Bundle.title: Improved Sidestep
Bundle.description: You are adept at sidestepping your opponent's melee attacks without compromising your mobility.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 15, Dodge, Mobility, Sidestep.

Benefit.p: After sidestepping an opponent's missed attack using the Sidestep feat, you may still take a 5-foot step during your next turn, or you may move up to your full speed if you take an action to move during your next turn.

Normal.p: If you use the Sidestep feat, you cannot take a 5-foot step during your next turn.

Bundle.title: Improved Snap Shot
Bundle.description: You can take advantage of your opponent's vulnerabilities from a greater distance, and without exposing yourself.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 15, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, Weapon Focus, base attack bonus +9.

Benefit.p: You threaten an additional 5 feet with Snap Shot.

Normal.p: Making a ranged attack provokes attacks of opportunity.

Bundle.title: Improved Spring Attack
Bundle.description: You dart through the press of battle like a breeze, assaulting foes as you pass.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 15, Dodge, Mobility, Nimble Moves, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +9.

Benefit.p: When you use Spring Attack, you can select two targets to attack during your movement instead of one. The second attack made this way is made at your full base attack bonus - 5. All restrictions of Spring Attack apply to both targets, and your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from either target. You can't target the same creature twice.

Special.p: A monk of at least 14th level can select this feat as a monk bonus feat, but only if he has Spring Attack.

Bundle.title: Improved Steal
Bundle.description: You have a knack for snatching items from your opponents.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a steal combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to steal an item from a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to steal an item from you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a steal combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Sunder
Bundle.description: You are skilled at damaging your foes' weapons and armor.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to sunder your gear.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Surprise Follow-Through
Bundle.Prerequisites: Str 13, Cleave, Great Cleave, Power Attack, Surprise Follow Through, base attack bonus +8.

Benefit.p: When using Great Cleave, each opponent you attack on your turn (other than the first) is denied his Dexterity bonus against you.

Bundle.title: Improved Trip
Bundle.description: You are skilled at sending your opponents to the ground.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

Benefit.p: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to trip you.

Normal.p: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver.

Bundle.title: Improved Two-Weapon Feint
Bundle.description: Your primary weapon keeps a foe off balance, allowing you to slip your off-hand weapon past his defenses.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 17, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Feint, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: While using Two-Weapon Fighting to make melee attacks, you can forgo your first primary-hand melee attack to make a Bluff check to feint an opponent. If you successfully feint, that opponent is denied his Dexterity bonus to AC until the end of your turn.

Bundle.title: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting
Bundle.description: You are skilled at fighting with two weapons.
Bundle.Prerequisites: Dex 17, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.

Benefit.p: In addition to the standard single extra attack you get with an off-hand weapon, you get a second attack with it, albeit at a -5 penalty.

Normal.p: Without this feat, you can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.
FAQ

If you use Two-Weapon Fighting on your turn to attack with two weapons, do you also take that penalty on attacks of opportunity made before the start of your next turn? How long do the penalties last?
